content.description: Sit start and climb the right side of this amazingly pure arete all the way to the top.
Sit start matched on a decent crimp with a good left foot. Make a hard move up and left, then keep it together for a few more moves to topout.
content.location: ~100 yards past Sunset Arete area, right of the trail facing downhill.

content.description: Sit start on a right facing crimpy flake. Climb the arete to the top using some small crimps to a tricky topout.
content.location: After taking the trail to the left into the Light Side, continue another 100 yards to this cluster of boulders. All the lines actually face downhill. Sunset Arete is the rightmost climb on the wall.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the obvious overhanging compression arete. Slap up to be able to gain the right side, then using crazy toe hooks come in and match. Cruise the right side to the point and topout.
On the left side of the "vaccum sealed" boulder, climb up just right of the arete using side pulls and big moves.
content.location: ~200 yards past the Sunset Arete area, the Vacuum Sealed boulder is a 30 foot tall monster facing downhill with bone white rock and crazy squiggle features.

content.description: To the right of Pinnacle and left of the crazy white blankness, cruise the iron feature up and left all the way to the top.
content.location: Just right of Pinnacle on the "Vacuum Sealed" boulder, ~200 yards past the Sunset Arete area on the Light Side.

content.description: First done around a decade ago, this heinous crimp line used to be considered Joel's V9, but has yet to see a repeat. To the right of Silver Tongue, sit start on the face matched on the only obvious jug. Climb up and left through micro crimps to a big move to catch the lip, and it's still not over.
content.location: Right of Silver Tongue, Sunset Arete area.

content.description: The Light Side at Upper Casparis has some of the best lines in the area. The rock here can be bigger grain, similar to Coopers, but the lines are fantastically pure and hard. There are many many established climbs here, mostly done by Tim Anderson and crew back in the 2000's. Listed here are just a very small portion of the classics.
